intro: Phacelia popei var. similis, commonly known as the Sierra phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its blue to purple flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, often in mountainous regions. It has small, ovate leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
